     for size in 1, 2, 5, 10:

         shape = batch_dims + (size, size)

body:
Yes, that should fix the gradient.
It might be worth discussing if the gradient should be hermitian instead of the lower triangular matrix, since the user provides a hermitian matrix as the input and the fact that only the lower triangular is used is an implementation detail of the OP. E.g. if the input was a variable it would not be hermitian anymore after applying the gradient.

Yes, that should fix the gradient.
It might be worth discussing if the gradient should be hermitian instead of the lower triangular matrix, since the user provides a hermitian matrix as the input and the fact that only the lower triangular is used is an implementation detail of the OP. E.g. if the input was a variable it would not be hermitian anymore after applying the gradient.
body_text:
Yes, that should fix the gradient.
It might be worth discussing if the gradient should be hermitian instead of the lower triangular matrix, since the user provides a hermitian matrix as the input and the fact that only the lower triangular is used is an implementation detail of the OP. E.g. if the input was a variable it would not be hermitian anymore after applying the gradient.
